items.label: Module 3: The AI-Robot Brain (NVIDIA Isaac Sim)

intro.title: Introduction
intro.description: Welcome to the Physical AI & Humanoid Robotics textbook! This comprehensive course bridges the gap between digital AI (LLMs/Agents) and physical embodiment (Robots), teaching you how to create embodied intelligence systems.

module-1-ros2/architecture.title: Understanding the Graph: Nodes, Topics, & Services

module-1-ros2/python-agents.title: Building Your First Agent with rclpy

module-1-ros2/urdf.title: Defining the Body: Introduction to URDF

module-1/intro-ros2.title: Module 1: The Robotic Nervous System (ROS 2)
module-1/intro-ros2.description: Welcome to the foundation of robotics - the Robot Operating System (ROS 2). In this module, you'll learn how robots communicate and coordinate their actions through a distributed network of nodes, topics, and services.

module-1/python-agents.title: Python Agents with rclpy
module-1/python-agents.description: In this section, we'll explore how to create intelligent agents using Python and the Robot Operating System 2 (ROS 2) through the rclpy library.

module-1/urdf.title: URDF: Robot Description Format
module-1/urdf.description: URDF (Unified Robot Description Format) is an XML format used to describe robot models in ROS. It defines the physical and visual properties of a robot.

module-2/gazebo-physics.title: Module 2: The Digital Twin (Gazebo)
module-2/gazebo-physics.description: In this module, you'll explore the world of robotics simulation, where physical robots are mirrored in digital environments. Simulation is crucial for testing algorithms safely before deploying them on real hardware.

module-2/sensors.title: Sensor Simulation
module-2/sensors.description: In robotics simulation, accurate sensor modeling is crucial for developing and testing perception algorithms before deployment on real hardware.

module-2/unity-rendering.title: Unity Rendering for Robotics
module-2/unity-rendering.description: Unity provides high-fidelity rendering capabilities that can be integrated with robotics simulation for photorealistic environments and sensor simulation.

module-3/isaac-sim.title: Module 3: The AI-Robot Brain (NVIDIA Isaac Sim)
module-3/isaac-sim.description: This module focuses on NVIDIA's Isaac Sim platform, which combines physics simulation with advanced rendering to create highly realistic digital twins for AI development.

module-3/nav2.title: Navigation 2 (Nav2)
module-3/nav2.description: Navigation 2 (Nav2) is the navigation stack for ROS 2, providing path planning, obstacle avoidance, and localization capabilities for mobile robots.

module-3/vslam.title: Visual SLAM
module-3/vslam.description: Visual Simultaneous Localization and Mapping (VSLAM) is a critical technology for autonomous robots to understand and navigate their environment.

module-4/capstone.title: Capstone: Autonomous Humanoid
module-4/capstone.description: The capstone project brings together all concepts learned throughout the course to create an autonomous humanoid robot capable of understanding natural language commands and executing complex tasks.

module-4/llm-planning.title: LLM Cognitive Planning
module-4/llm-planning.description: Large Language Models (LLMs) can be used for high-level cognitive planning in robotics, enabling robots to understand complex tasks and generate action sequences.

module-4/whisper-voice.title: Module 4: Vision-Language-Action (VLA)
module-4/whisper-voice.description: In the final module, you'll learn how to create robots that can understand human language, perceive their environment, and take appropriate actions - the essence of embodied AI.
